Actually, based on the bug description:
- `@nuxt/ui v4` renamed `options` prop to `items` on `USelectMenu`
- It also renamed `value-attribute` to `value-key` and `option-attribute` to `label-key`

Let me verify this by checking the @nuxt/ui v4 documentation or changelog.

input.prompt: What props does USelectMenu use in v4? Specifically what prop is used for providing options/items, and what props are used for value-key and label-key?

content.content:
# USelectMenu v4 Props for Items and Keys

Based on the documentation, here are the key props:

**Items/Options Prop:**
The `items` prop provides the selectable options. It accepts "an array of strings, numbers or booleans" or an array of objects with properties like `label`, `icon`, `avatar`, etc.

**Value Key Prop:**
The `valueKey` prop allows you to "select the field to use as the value instead of the object itself" when working with object arrays. This defaults to `undefined`, meaning the entire object is used as the value.

**Label Key Prop:**
The `labelKey` prop lets you "select the field to use as the label" from object arrays, with a default of `"label"`.

**Key Distinction:**
Unlike the basic Select component, the SelectMenu "expects the whole object to be passed to the `v-model` directive or the `default-value` prop by default" unless you specify a `valueKey` to bind to a specific property instead.

tool_use_result.result:
# USelectMenu v4 Props for Items and Keys

Based on the documentation, here are the key props:

**Items/Options Prop:**
The `items` prop provides the selectable options. It accepts "an array of strings, numbers or booleans" or an array of objects with properties like `label`, `icon`, `avatar`, etc.

**Value Key Prop:**
The `valueKey` prop allows you to "select the field to use as the value instead of the object itself" when working with object arrays. This defaults to `undefined`, meaning the entire object is used as the value.

**Label Key Prop:**
The `labelKey` prop lets you "select the field to use as the label" from object arrays, with a default of `"label"`.

**Key Distinction:**
Unlike the basic Select component, the SelectMenu "expects the whole object to be passed to the `v-model` directive or the `default-value` prop by default" unless you specify a `valueKey` to bind to a specific property instead.

content.thinking:
Now I have the full picture for @nuxt/ui v4:
- `options` → `items`
- `value-attribute` → `value-key` (camelCase in template: `value-key`)
- `option-attribute` → `label-key` (camelCase in template: `label-key`)

For `USelect` (used in `pages/debug/preview.vue`):
Let me check that too, since it uses `:options=`.

input.prompt: What props does USelect use in v4? Specifically what prop is used for providing options/items?

content.content:
# USelect Props in v4

The primary prop for providing options to USelect is **`items`**.

According to the documentation, the `items` prop accepts:
- "an array of strings, numbers or booleans"
- An array of objects with properties like `label`, `value`, `icon`, `avatar`, `chip`, and `disabled`
- "an array of arrays to the `items` prop to display separated groups of items"

Other key props include:
- **`modelValue`** - the controlled selected value (used with `v-model`)
- **`defaultValue`** - initial value when uncontrolled
- **`valueKey`** - specifies which object property to use as the value (defaults to `"value"`)
- **`labelKey`** - specifies which property to display as the label
- **`multiple`** - enables selecting multiple options

tool_use_result.result:
# USelect Props in v4

The primary prop for providing options to USelect is **`items`**.

According to the documentation, the `items` prop accepts:
- "an array of strings, numbers or booleans"
- An array of objects with properties like `label`, `value`, `icon`, `avatar`, `chip`, and `disabled`
- "an array of arrays to the `items` prop to display separated groups of items"

Other key props include:
- **`modelValue`** - the controlled selected value (used with `v-model`)
- **`defaultValue`** - initial value when uncontrolled
- **`valueKey`** - specifies which object property to use as the value (defaults to `"value"`)
- **`labelKey`** - specifies which property to display as the label
- **`multiple`** - enables selecting multiple options

input.command:
gh pr create --title "fix: correct USelectMenu/USelect props for @nuxt/ui v4" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary
- Replace deprecated `options` prop with `items` on all `USelectMenu` and `USelect` components
- Replace `value-attribute` with `value-key` and `option-attribute` with `label-key` (v4 API rename)
- Cherry-pick QA E2E tests from `test/task-2-qa-testing` branch (was not yet on main)

## Root Cause
`@nuxt/ui` v4 renamed the `options` prop to `items` on select components. The code still used the v3 prop names, causing dropdowns to render with "No data" and no selectable options.

## Files Changed
- `components/AppHeader.vue` — fix Document Type and Template dropdowns
- `pages/debug/template.vue` — fix template selector dropdown
- `pages/debug/preview.vue` — fix XML sample selector (USelect)
- `tests/e2e/task-2-xml-parser.spec.ts` — add QA E2E tests (from QA branch)
- `docs/test-reports/task-2-xml-parser-qa-report.md` — QA report

## Test plan
- [ ] Open app, confirm Document Type dropdown shows options (Cover Letter, etc.)
- [ ] Confirm Template dropdown shows options (Modern, Classic, Minimal)
- [ ] Visit `/debug/template` and confirm template selector works
- [ ] Visit `/debug/preview` and confirm XML sample selector works

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

content.content: https://github.com/kimwwk/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/pull/26

content.text:
## Status
DONE

## What Changed
- `components/AppHeader.vue` — replaced `:options` → `:items`, `value-attribute` → `value-key`, `option-attribute` → `label-key` on both USelectMenu components (Document Type and Template dropdowns)
- `pages/debug/template.vue` — same prop fixes on USelectMenu template selector
- `pages/debug/preview.vue` — replaced `:options` → `:items` on USelect XML sample selector
- `tests/e2e/task-2-xml-parser.spec.ts` + `docs/test-reports/task-2-xml-parser-qa-report.md` — cherry-picked from `test/task-2-qa-testing` branch (QA tests were not on main)

## Key Decisions
- Also fixed `value-attribute`/`option-attribute` → `value-key`/`label-key` since these were also renamed in @nuxt/ui v4 and would cause the v-model binding to not work correctly even after the `items` fix
- Included QA test files via cherry-pick in the same PR rather than a separate one, since the task asked to check and merge them

## PR / Branch
- Branch: `fix/dropdown-items-prop`
- PR: https://github.com/kimwwk/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/pull/26

result:
## Status
DONE

## What Changed
- `components/AppHeader.vue` — replaced `:options` → `:items`, `value-attribute` → `value-key`, `option-attribute` → `label-key` on both USelectMenu components (Document Type and Template dropdowns)
- `pages/debug/template.vue` — same prop fixes on USelectMenu template selector
- `pages/debug/preview.vue` — replaced `:options` → `:items` on USelect XML sample selector
- `tests/e2e/task-2-xml-parser.spec.ts` + `docs/test-reports/task-2-xml-parser-qa-report.md` — cherry-picked from `test/task-2-qa-testing` branch (QA tests were not on main)

## Key Decisions
- Also fixed `value-attribute`/`option-attribute` → `value-key`/`label-key` since these were also renamed in @nuxt/ui v4 and would cause the v-model binding to not work correctly even after the `items` fix
- Included QA test files via cherry-pick in the same PR rather than a separate one, since the task asked to check and merge them

## PR / Branch
- Branch: `fix/dropdown-items-prop`
- PR: https://github.com/kimwwk/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/pull/26
